result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnie Bernard Smith Jr

records.addlTxt: Case set for status of counsel on 10/25/2022; State's witness not present.

Defendant Ronnie Bernard Smith Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  Defendant appears without counsel; defendant not eligible for SPD services. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-25-2022

Defendant Ronnie Bernard Smith Jr appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-23-2022

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-09-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 3 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Ronnie Bernard Smith Jr in court.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Ronnie Bernard Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
